game

Class CollisionDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.CollisionDetection

  • public class CollisionDetection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to detect any collisions that occur in the game. Features of Version 3.0: This class was created (the hasCollided method) and it is used to detect collisions. Time spent: 10 min. Features of Version 5.0: Another method was added to do calculations for movement directions after collisions. Time spent on this class: 35 min.
    Version:
    5.0, June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Salar Hosseini & Sophia Weng

    • Method Detail

      • hasCollided

        public static boolean hasCollided(java.awt.Rectangle a,
                  java.awt.Rectangle b)
        This static method is used to return true or false depending on whether or not two rectangles (boundaries of objects) collide. The if statement is used to check if the two rectangles instersect. If so, true is returned. If not false will eventually be returned.
        Parameters:
        a - This object reference variable stores the first Rectangle object that will be checked to see if it collides with the other.
        b - This object reference variable stores the secoond Rectangle object that will be checked to see if it collides with the other.
        Returns:
        boolean (True if rectangles collide, false if they do not).

      • getMoveDirections

        public static int[] getMoveDirections(double x1,
                      double x2,
                      double y1,
                      double y2,
                      int speed)
        This method is used to get the increment of the x position and y position of any moving object. The first if statement is used to check if the change in x values (the rise) is not 0. If so, then the appropriate direction for the movement is calculated. The second if statement is used to check if the increment in the x variable calculated and stored has the apropriate value of negative or positive. If it does not, that value is multiplyed by -1; The third if statement is used to check if the increment in the y variable calculated and stored has the apropriate value of negative or positive. If it does not, that value is multiplyed by -1;
        Parameters:
        x1 - This double stores the first x position in the calculation of the slope.
        x2 - This double stores the second x position in the calculation of the slope.
        y1 - This double stores the first y position in the calculation of the slope.
        y2 - This double stores the second y position in the calculation of the slope.
        speed - This integer stores the speed of the movement that will be calculated.
        moveX - This integer stores the run of the two x positions (target and location).
        moveY - This integer stores the rise of the two x positions (target and location).
        direction - This double stores the direction that the movement being calculated will take place in.
        moveX2 - This integer stores the calculated increment in the x position which is used during the movement of whatever Entity uses it.
        moveY2 - This integer stores the calculated increment in the y position which is used during the movement of whatever Entity uses it.
        directions - This array of integers will store the increment in the x position and the y position which have been calculated.
        Returns:
        int [] The array of integers storing the increment in the x position and the y position which have been calculated, is returned.
